data.name: Nagarkot Sunrise View and Day Hiking from Kathmandu
data.price: from $85.00 per adult (price varies by group size)
data.about:
A mountain village in Nepal, Nagarkot is famous for its sunrise views over the Himalayas. On this tour from Kathmandu, enjoy an early morning panorama over world-renowned peaks before a scenic hike to Changu Narayan. Visit other villages as you make your way through the country’s picturesque hillsides before arriving at the UNESCO-listed temple. A private guide means plenty of personal attention, and hotel pickup makes for a seamless experience.Me and my sister really enjoyed our trip to nagarkot and the hike to the hindu temple. It was great to get out of the craziness of kathmandu for the day and breath clean air up in the hills and watch the sunrise. It was a little foggy but we still had lovely views of langtang and the ganesh himal range.Our guide Bidur was friendly, chatty and answered all of our questions. It was interesting to learn about the mountains from him and also more about Nepali life and Hinduism. We didnt feel rushed and he took us for a lovely breakfast and offered us to stop for tea later in the day too.Would recommend to people who want to see how many nepali people live and have a short mountain escape from the valley and stretch their legs on a lovely downhill/flat walk. Thank you for the great day!Jen and HayHi Jennifer,

Thank you very much for taking a service with us and glad to know that you get good service from our guide. We are always focus how to improve our services and hope we are able to give you five star services in next time. Have a nice time!The Nargakot sunrise and day hike tour was a truly memorable experience for us. We got the best view of the sunrise over the Himalayan ranges from the Nargakot tower, which is a small tower in the middle of the viewpoint area. Following the sunrise was a breakfast paid by ourselves (not included in the tour) at a hotel recommended by our tour guide. After breakfast, we started the 13-km hike from Nargakot to Changu Narayan temple. The hike was easy and mostly downhills, taking us through the villages where we could see the daily life of Nepali people. We did the tour in late December so it was freezing during the sunrise, but afterwards the hike warmed us up and it got hot later in the sun. So one pro tip is layer up for the morning and get ready to leave your jackets in the car when the hike began.Communication with the tour organizer was fast and responsive. Our guide Som was also very helpful and knowledgeable. Would highly recommend this tour!Hi Bac,

"Happy New Year 2023."

Thank you very much for visiting Kathmandu and taking Nagarkot Sunrise and hiking with us. Glad to know that you loved this hiking. Looking forward to see you again. Namaste!We booked this tour to enjoy the trekking experiences and to see sunrise and mount Everest from Nagarkot View point in Nepal. It was well worth. We were lucky to see the sunrise view and Himalayas mountain chain due to weather permit and it was breathtaking. Breakfast was not that good. I was hoping to enjoy local nepalese cuisine.After breakfast, we went for trekking and it was nice experience short version of trekking through nepal local village. The last stop was at Changu Narayan - UNESCO World Heritage Site.  Our Guide Madan was experience and he explained well about the trekking experiences.Would recommend!!!Hello Thein,

Thank you so much for booking a trip with us. It's our great pleasure that you enjoyed your trip along with our guide Madan. But, we feel sorry that you can't get a chance to enjoy local Nepalese cuisine. We looked forward to serving you again in Nepal.I had a great time on this tour! Shishir was a very knowledgeable guide, always in good spirits! The hike is a good way to explore the countryside in Nepal, giving you a different perspective of Kathmandu.Everyone was on time and very responsive, despite the smog, we could still get a glimpse of the mountain ranges for sunrise. I recommend this tour!Hi Ivo,

Thank you for sharing your feedback about the trip and glad to know you liked this trip. As you understand that we can not control in the weather but service part is our major focus and glad that our guide Shisir able to offer you good service and the information. Looking forward to serve you in the future again for longer holidays. The transportation will bring you to the highest point, and from there walk downhill all the time (except 20min up, easy trek), passing by small villages and some temples.What could be improved: for the coffee break/breakfast at the start of the trek (at your on expense, obviously) could have been in a restaurant with an impressive view, instead of the so-so place they chose. He also does longer treks in the Anapurna range, so he was great to talk to!Hi Carolina,

Thank you so much for taking a service with us and glad you enjoyed this trip. We are trying to upgrade our service as much as we can in coming days and hope this COVID19 will stop. We got collected from our hotel and driven up to the view point in time for the sunrise which was beautiful even with it being hazy. Afterward we went for breakfast followed by the hike. data.name: Everest Base Camp Trek - 14 Days
data.about:
Firstly I’ll start by saying that doing the Basecamp trek in winter is extremely difficult. The actual walking was easy, it had a few hard parts but overall quite a good trek. The hard part was dealing with the cold especially coming from Australia when it’s been over 30+ degrees and coming into temperatures of -20 to -30 degrees. The altitude was a hard one to judge. Sometimes you felt great and then other times you walked 15 metres and you we’re out of breath. Overall the trek was amazing but I think I would’ve definitely preferred it in the summertime. My guides name is Pasang Dawa who works for Ace the Himalayas. He’s very good at speaking English which was very helpful because a lot of other guides struggled with that. He was very caring and always put others before himself. data.about: I had a lovely day today with Kessar, a very friendly and extremely knowledgeable guide who explained in detail a lot of the things that we saw as we drove to our destination. The weather wasn't ideal today, but we still managed to see some peaks of the Himalayas. Then we went to the ancient city of Bhaktapur, where Kessar guided me through the parts, along with teachings of the local traditions, religions, and customs. I highly recommend this trip! No doubt the most stunning combination I did in Kathmandu valley. The view from Nargakot is just amazing, we had a nice cup of tea up there as well. Bhaktapur is the most lovely city in kathmandu valley, I could spend days there just enjoying life there with the stunning architecture and warm weather. I was in Bhaktapur the day before already so the friendly guide adapted his tour a bit. We talked quite a while about the unifying of the kingdoms of Nepal and the famous knife of the Nepali military. Very interesting stories about Nepals history.Prashant was an excellent tour guide. He was extremely knowledgeable and was a fun addition to the sightseeing. If you’re going to visit Bhaktapur, we HIGHLY recommend booking with Prashant and his company.Also, Bhaktapur is well worth seeing. It was definitely a highlight to our Nepal trip…Thanks Prashant 🙏My tour guide was Mukesh who was excellent if you have the opportunity to do the tour with him definitely take it, he was very knowledgeable and kind. The tour was amazing, the view you get from Nagarkot was one of the best views I have seen in my life. The view of the Himalayas in contrast to the valley filled with rice and potato farms was breathtaking. The rich culture, beautiful temples and wood carvings of Bahktapur was well worth it. I can recommend this tour as it is one I will not forget.On a three day stop over in Kathmandu I was so busy figuring out visas for India that I almost gave up on seeing the Himalaya mountain ranges until I found this trip.  Ask for KESHAR he’s a knowledgeable and sensitive guide, senior and who doesn’t just tell you dates and names, he brings you into the stories.  Would rebook it tomorrow. Thanks!An excellent tour with Dipesh who was able to provide lots of interesting information on Nepali culture, religion and architecture. Unfortunately we did not have good weather so we were not able to enjoy the views at Nagarkot. I was grateful for the umbrella when we were walking around the old city of BhaktapurDon't shop around, just do this one! It's an amazing tour. Our guide was Mukesh Shah and our driver was Rabi Pokhrel and they both went above and beyond to make sure our private day trip was beyond amazing. Very professional and knowledgeable.  Just truly amazing Nepali people as your hosts for the day. You will not regret it!!Really appreciated the historical insights and illustrative descriptions of our guide. Even though it was overcast in Nagorkot, the trip to Bhaktapur more than made up for it. Would definitely recommend this to any travelers who want to do a quick one-day tour of this historical site!We really enjoyed this tour. The view of Himalaya from Nagarkot is spectacular. Our guide Subash made sure we spend enough time to take in all the views. And the road to Nagarkot was a bit dangerous, with narrow one-lane winding dirt road uphill with cliff on the side. Our guide Subash particularly asked for a safe driver for the trip, since the driver for the previous day was not very safe. He also made sure that we saw the nice terrace crop field along the way. The ancient capital of Bhaktapur is also very nice. Subash made sure we take our time to see everything we want to see, and no rush us. Overall, we are very happy with the two-day tour with breakaway adventure private tour. The only thing we wish for improvement is to have a car with safety belt.We had a wonderful day-trip guided by wonderful Shankar whose endless well of knowledge enriched our day. Bhaktapur is a wonderous place, suffered in 2015 earthquake, but rebuild is well on the way. The original buildings are full of beautifully crafted details. Nagarkot views and fresh (mountain to us but just a hill to the locals) air where the second highlight of the day. Our driver Ravi expertly navigated the narrow and curvy roads. data.name: Day Trip to Bhaktapur and Panauti from Kathmandu
data.about:
Overall the place is definitely mesmerizing. However my guide didn't seem to have much to say about these places. Felt like we were just strolling through and getting it done. They advertised to finish the trip at 6:15pm but  was actually asked to leave with them around 4:30pm. I reasoned and wanted to spend more time there then they did stretch it to 5pm... So I let him go and stayed back on my own. Took a ride at my own expense and went back. Overall I felt like I could have just been with myself and had a better time. More like I paid for transportation, that too was one way only. Wouldn't recommend based on my experience.Was a great intimate tour of two culturally significant Nepali cities. The tour also provided a wonderful insight to Newari culture (the local people). The guide was very insightful and knowledgeable - their excitement and love for their city was amazing. Would recommend for travellers looking to explore these two cities!We had a wonderful tour to the Unesco site Bhaktapur and quiet old town Panauti with guide Dilip Shakya and driver Shanti Ghisting.Dilip’s knowledge of Nepalese history and culture was above our expectations.it was the last and the best day during our visit to Kathmandu and we highly recommend this tour to travelers. We liked Royal mountain travel company - everything was very well organized and guide Dilip and driver Shanti made our trip unforgettable.Thank you!Steven and IrinaDear Guest,

Thank you for taking the time to leave such a kind review of your experience with us. We're thrilled to hear that you had a wonderful time on your tour to Bhaktapur and Panauti with our guide Dilip Shakya and our Road Captain Shanti Ghisting.

It's fantastic to hear that Dilip's knowledge of Nepalese history and culture exceeded your expectations and that this tour was the highlight of your visit to Kathmandu. 

Thank you for choosing Royal Mountain Travel Company for your travels, and we hope to have the pleasure of welcoming you back on another adventure in the future.

Thank you,This was a very nice day tour. My guide was excellent and explained things very clearly.  I had time to look without feeling hurried which I appreciate. I would recommend this tour to anyone who wants a hassle free experience while visiting NepalI had the most incredible time on my tours with Royal Mountain Travel. Thank you very much for choosing Royal Mountain Travel. Many thanks for your lovely review! We aim to delight our customer every time and we’re pleased that we were able to meet your expectations. Naturally and Culturally rich, Nepal once is not enough. Therefore, looking forward to serve you again in the near future. 

Best Regards, Dilip is a very sympathetic and knowledgeable tour guide with many insider's tips, e.g. for interesting/special Panauti places (only few tourists get to see these) or for the best Juju Dhau Joghurt in town. Reliable transport with cold water available. Highly recommended trip for tourists interested in Nepal/Bhaktapur/Panauti.Dear Guest, 
Greetings!!!

We are happy that you found our services well, and thank you very much for your kind words and excellent review.

Best RegardsGuides are a must to understand this fascinating medieval city.  As in most UNESCO sites, street vendors are as thick as soup. No to them means maybe, if they persist enough, so just ignore them. If you buy one trinket, they will be on you like locusts for more. Public toilets are filthy. Carry your own toilet paper. You probably do not want to sit down, so try to go before you get there.Dear Guest,
Greetings!!!

Thank you for sharing the information. We are grateful for the amount of time and effort you put into helping us. Your insights and summary are beneficial for us and our guest.

Best WishesWe had an outstanding day thanks to Dilip and the driver (sorry, name forgotten, but she was great at taking advantage of the narrowest gap and keeping us going despite the busy lead up to the festival)!Unique and unmissable experience in the rural town of Panauti, learning about the Hindu deities and understanding the meaning and history of the temples, and then walking around after the rice has been harvested watching the sifting and dryng in the open spaces.Then the classic tour around the amazing Bhaktapur, seeing historic monuments and the royal palace, though disappointed that as non-Hindus we were not allowed into the central courtyard of the palace. We were surprised by an impromptu course in pottery and also in Thanka painting.Not to forget a great Newari lunch with local specialities known to Dilip and very well chosen and explained by him, and rice beer!Full marks for a great experience and for Dilip responding to our interest, and fit making us feel so welcome.I enjoyed visiting both destinations. I learned a lot about Nepal and it's people from my guide, who was very knowledgeable.Bhaktapur Durbar is extremely fascinating and definitely worth a visit. I didn't know about Panauti as all, and was also positively surprised. It is a traditional, tranquil Newari town, where you can escape the hassle of the big city.Overall, fully recommended :)We really enjoyed our tour to Bhaktapur and Panauti. The drive was very comfortable and we enjoyed looking round Bhaktapur despite the rain. Our guide, Akshay, was very knowledgeable about the history of the area and knew lots of stories too. He taloured the tour to our interests, trying some Juju Dhau and pottery making!Lunch at our homestay was delicious and included trying our hand at some cooking!Thank you!
